metadata.title: New possibilities of isoprenoids chemistry when using a heterogeneous catalyst: Askanite—bentonite clay

Volcho *, D.V. Korchagina, N.F. Salakhutdinov, V.A. Barkhash Novosibirsk ~ nstitute of Organic chemistry, Novosibirsk 630090, Russia 1~ eceived 15 April 1997; accepted 17 May 1997 Abstract We showed that new heterocyclization reactions resulting in the compounds of a unique structure and a potential biological activity proceed when hydroxy,91efins of menthane and carane series are allowed to react with salicylaldehyde 1 on askanite-bentonite clay at room temperature. Slight changes in isoprenoid structure yield significantly different reaction products. 1997 Elsevier Science B.V. 1. Introduction 'Fastening' via adsorption on solid catalysts is one of the most powerful methods of effect- ing chemical compounds reactivity. The use of this approach in the case of polyfanctional and conformationally-mobile natural isoprenoids causes either an abrupt change in the process selectivity, or the reaction take a aew path [1]. CHO 1 2 + 3 Scheme 1. 4 2. Results and discussion Thus, the interaction of isomeric 6-hydroxy- methylisolimonene, 2, and 6-hydroxymethyl- limonene, 3, with aldehyde, l, results in the compounds of different framework, 4 and 5, correspondingly (Scheme 1). * Corresponding author. Fax: (7-3832) 354-752. Possible mechanisms of transformations are represented in Scheme 2. The reactivity of homologues 4-(1-hydroxy- ethyl)-2-carene, 6, and 4-(1-hydroxyethyl)-2- carene, 7, is rather different (Scheme 3), which is rarely observed under homogeneous condi- tions of the reaction. The structure of compound 10 is indicative of a radically different reaction pathway available in the case of isoprenoid, 7, as compared with its homologue 6. Possible mechanisms of transformations are represented in Schemes 4 and 5. 1381-1169/97/$17.00 1997 Elsevier Science', B.V. All rights reserved. PII S 1381-1169(97)00119-2 .86 K.P. Volcho et al. /Journal of Molecular Catalysis A." Chemical 125 (1997) L85-L86 + H+ HO ~ H HO - H +~- HO +H+ 1 L o o 1 &C~H "&'OH "~ IB "x\OH -H+ -H20 HO Scheme 2. CHO 1 + 7 9 10 Scheme 3. The transformations found do not proceed without a catalyst or in the presence of acetic acid. 3. Experimental 3.1. Equipment The structure of all the obtained compounds was proven with the aid of 1H and 13C NMR spectra (Bruker AM-400); high resolution mass-spectra were recorded on Finnigan Mat MS-8200. 3.2. General procedure A solution of aldehyde 1 and isoprenoid in CH2C12 was added to a suspension of clay in CH2C12 and stirred at room temperature for 0.5-6 h. After the catalyst separation the reac- tion mixture was divided on a column with SiO2 (40-100 /x) and A1203 (neutral). Yields: 4, 18%; 5, 34%; 8, 20%; 9 and 10, 41%. ~ clio/-',,i-P- Fmo I A- +He _ O HO '/ 10 Scheme 5. 4. Conclusions The use of askanite-bentonite clay as a cata- lyst allowed a new type of isoprenoid transfor- mations to be found, that is the formation of polyheterocyclic systems. New transformations akin to biomimetic ones through the mild condi- tions of their generation have been found. 6 O ~ HO H20 8 References [1] K.P. Volcho, LE. Tatarova, D.V. Korchagina, N.F. Salakhutdinov, I.S. Aulchenco, K.G. Ione, V.A. Barkhash, Zh. Org. Khim. 30 (1994) 641. Scheme 4. Fax:(7-3832) 354-752. We showed that new heterocyclization reactions resulting in the compounds of a unique structure and a potential biological activity proceed when hydroxyolefins of menthane and carane seriies are allowed to react with salicylaldehyde 1 on askanite—bentonite clay at room temperature. Slight changes in isoprenoid structure yield significantly different reaction products. References [1] K.P Volcho L.E Tatarova D.V Korchagina N.F Salakhutdinov I.S Aulchenco K.G Ione V.A Barkhash Zh. Org. Khim. 30 1994 641
